description: Prime(n)*...*prime(a(n)) is the least product of consecutive primes which is abundant.
prog: (PARI) a(n) = {p = prime(n); sig = p+1; prd = p; np = n; while (sig <= 2*prd, p = nextprime(p+1); sig *= p+1; prd *= p; np++;); return (np);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 10 2013
crossrefs: Cf. A005101, A007684 (a very similar sequence), A007708, A007741.
author: _Walter Nissen_
extensions: More terms from Don Reble (djr(AT)nk.ca), Nov 10 2005
